RT @janella_angeles: THIS. I spent much of my school years drowning in names I never asked for.   Protip: Don't just give ppl nicknames. Thâ€¦
and even if you haven't seen some names before
column4: they still deserve the same respect as names you have

text: but even if they don't have a meaning or cultural significance
column4: they're still important

text: and it really hurt. names are important. some have meanings. mine
column4: for example

text: people would ask to give me nicknames or change my name because  akshaya was "too hard to remember"
substitute teachers would trip over a name on the roster or stutter without saying anything & i knew to raise my hand
growing up i hated my name. it made me feel like i was a burden on other people because i had to make them learn a "hard name"
â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸ this thread is everything. saying/spelling someone's name right is just common courtesy https://t.co/cPgo4qGLCB
